New Records: Freddie Freeman left the game after an injury, which may impact the Dodgers' lineup for the postseason
Key Match Events: Will Smith hit a tying, two-run homer in the 7th inning
Los Angeles scored three more runs in the 7th inning
The Dodgers clinched the NL West title with the win
The Padres led 2-0 early in the game
Pre-Game Insights: The game was a sellout with 52,433 fans in attendance
Both teams had already secured postseason berths prior to the game
Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of the game for the Dodgers
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts expressed pride in the team's resilience and effort
The Dodgers had not clinched a title at home since the 2020 season
Freddie Freeman's injury was a significant moment in the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Walker Buehler and Joe Musgrove had strong performances on the mound
The game included multiple defensive plays, including a throwing error by Fernando Tatis Jr.
The Padres' bullpen struggled in the later innings
Others: The Dodgers activated Anthony Banda from the injured list
Brusdar Graterol was placed on the injured list with shoulder inflammation
Miguel Rojas suffered a torn adductor and will be sidelined for a few days
